references.reason: This paper introduced a foundational neural image compression model that many subsequent works, including this one, built upon.

references.paper_title: Full resolution image compression with recurrent neural networks
references.reason: This work was one of the first to successfully apply recurrent neural networks to image compression, demonstrating the potential of deep learning techniques for achieving high compression ratios.

references.paper_title: Variational image compression with a scale hyperprior
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of using a scale hyperprior in variational autoencoders for image compression, which significantly improved the performance and efficiency of existing models.

references.paper_title: Improving inference for neural image compression
references.reason: This paper introduced the Stochastic Gradient Gumbel Annealing (SGA) method which the current paper extends, providing the foundation for the work presented.

references.paper_title: Learned image compression with discretized gaussian mixture likelihoods and attention modules
references.reason: This paper provides a more recent state-of-the-art model that this paper uses as a basis for comparison, providing a strong benchmark for evaluating compression improvements.
